newsitem.title: FRANCE: Schiphol leads cargo traffic growth at EU airports.
newsitem.headline: Schiphol leads cargo traffic growth at EU airports.

text.p: Amsterdam's Schiphol airport recorded the highest percentage gain in cargo traffic last month among the EU's top cargo-handling airports, according to figures issued by the Paris airports authority, Aeroports de Paris (ADP).
Cargo traffic handled at Schiphol in October 1996 totalled 99,200 tonnes, up 14.9 percent on the same month in 1995.
The three London airports (Heathrow, Gatwick and Stansted) handled 130,200 tonnes of cargo traffic last month, a rise of 5.7 percent on October 1995.
At Frankfurt, October 1996 cargo throughput totalled 123,400 tonnes, up 4.8 percent on the same month last year.
Cargo at the Paris airports (Charles de Gaulle and Orly) last month fell by 0.9 percent on October 1995 to 96,761 tonnes.

Of the EU's top four cargo-handling airports, Amsterdam also recorded the highest percentage gain in cargo traffic in the first ten months of 1996 with volume rising by 11.4 percent to 880,800 tonnes.
Jan-Oct1996 cargo traffic handled at the London airports totalled 1,184,000 tonnes, up 5.1 percent on 1995 levels.
Frankfurt airport's handled 1,098,300 tonnes of cargo in Jan-Oct , up 2.8 percent on the same period last year.
Jan-Oct 1996 cargo traffic handled at the Paris airports declined by 0.5 percent on 1995 levels to 912,676 tonnes. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
